instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 b
threads.message: this macbook does not give video with a good screen, Could you tell me what measures to take initially, the fuse is good

threads.title: 820-3115 b
threads.message: Do you get USB activity and external video?

threads.title: 820-3115 b
threads.message:
So missing both image and backlight?
Check L9004/08/80.
Any history fault available?

threads.title: 820-3115 b
threads.message: excuse me, it is other logic board problem.This logic board problem missing both image and backlight, not usb activity and not video external.This macbook turn on, fans Rotate normal, memory ram good, both slots ram memory is good

threads.title: 820-3115 b
threads.message:
How do you know RAM slots are good, if board doesn't boot?
Not always get classic beep errors, for RAM problems.

Do you have PLT_RESET_L high?
Any history fault available?
What is the CPU core voltage after 10s?
Did you try known good BIOS?

threads.title: 820-3115 b
threads.message:
PLT_RESET_L=3.3V
Any history fault available?NOT
What is the CPU core voltage after 10s?1.12V constant
Did you try knoen good BIOS?yes, the problem persists; whith chipmunk usb tester, only 5v usb,but no data usb

threads.title: 820-3115 b
threads.message:
When board boots, VCORE should drop to 0.75V approx.
There may be a communication problem, because of bad PCH, or CPU.
Also possible to have bad trace, corroded, or knocked off resistor.
Check the series resistors from SPI lines and LPC bus.
